entry.title: Acre
entry.summary: An ancient port on the coast of Phoenice, and the last Crusader foothold in the Levant.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Adana — ܐܛܢܗ
entry.summary: A city on the Seyhan River in south-eastern Anatolia, near the Mediterranean coast.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Adharbayjān — ܐܕܪܒܝܓܐܢ
entry.summary: A region west of the Caspian Sea, encompassing the modern country of Azerbaijan and the provinces of northwest Iran.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Adiabene
entry.summary: Classical Adiabene, Syriac Ḥadyāb, refers to the region between the Upper and Lower Zab rivers, from the Tigris in the west to Mt. Ṣalāḥ al-dīn (= Mt. Pirmum) in the east.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Aegeae
entry.summary: An ancient and medieval port on the coast of Cilicia.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Aegyptus — ܡܨܪܝܢ
entry.summary: The Roman province of Egypt
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Afghanistan — ܐܦܓܐܢܣܬܐܢ
entry.summary: A region of Central Asia.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Akhlat — ܟܠܐܛ
entry.summary: A town on the northwestern coast of Lake Van in eastern Anatolia.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Aleppo — ܚܠܒ
entry.summary: City in northern Syria and an important center of Christianity in the Middle East today as the seat of a total of nine bishoprics.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Ālīn
entry.summary: A village in Ṭur ʿAbdin.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Alqosh
entry.summary: Town 40 km. north of Mosul in Iraq.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: al-Aḥmadiyya — ܐܚܡܕܝܗ
entry.summary: A village in al-Ṣawr region.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: al-Baḥrayn — ܒܚܪܝܢ
entry.summary: A place whose inhabitants received a letter from Ḥabīb b. Khidma Abū Rāʾiṭa.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: al-Khaḍarāʾ — ܝܪܘܩܬܐ
entry.summary: A church in Tagrit.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: al-Madāʾin
entry.summary: A group of settlements including Ctesiphon, Seleucia, and Kokhe.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Amida — ܐܡܝܕ
entry.summary: City in upper Mesopotamia.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Amman
entry.summary: An ancient town east of the Jordan River, now the capital of Jordan.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Amyūn
entry.summary: The town of Amyūn is situated 20 km. south of Tripoli (Northern Lebanon), on the road between Chekka and Kousba, built on a high, rocky cliff rising above the plains of olives and fruit orchards watered by the Qadisha river.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Anab — ܐܢܒ
entry.summary: A village northwest of Aleppo.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Anḥil — ܐܢܚܠ
entry.summary: A village in Ṭur ʿAbdin.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Antaradus — ܐܢܛܐܪܐܕܘܣ
entry.summary: A port city in Syria, modern Ṭarṭūs.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Antioch — ܐܢܛܝܘܟܝܐ
entry.summary: City in the historical region of Syria (today in Turkey).
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Apamea — ܐܘܦܡܝܐ
entry.summary: One of the earliest Hellenistic city foundations in Syria, Apamea, situated on the Orontes ca. 90 km. south of Antioch, from the 2nd cent. onwards was an important center of Middle- and Neo-Platonist philosophy.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Apamene
entry.summary: The region around Apamea
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Arabia
entry.summary: A Roman province including the Sinai peninsula and Roman territory east of the Jordan River.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Ārādn
entry.summary: A city in northern Iraq.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Arbela — ܐܪܒܝܠ
entry.summary: Capital of modern Kurdistan, in eastern Iraq.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Arbo — ܐܪܒܘ
entry.summary: A village in Ṭur ʿAbdin.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Ardamut
entry.summary: A village in northern Iraq.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Arethusa
entry.summary: A Hellenistic city near Apamea, now called al-Rastan.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Arragan
entry.summary: A village in Fars.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Arsanias
entry.summary: A river of eastern Anatolia which flows from north of Lake Van into the Euphrates above Melitene.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Ashitha
entry.summary: A city in the Hakkari mountains.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Awāna
entry.summary: A village in Iraq.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Bāb Allah — ܬܪܥ ܐܝܠ
entry.summary: A gate of Aleppo.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Bāb al-ʿĀmūd — ܬܪܥܐ ܕܥܡܘܕܐ
entry.summary: A district of Jerusalem.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Bāb Tūmā
entry.summary: A gate of Damascus.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Bādiya — ܒܐܕܝܐ
entry.summary: A village perhaps near Tagrit.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Baghdad — ܒܓܕܕ
entry.summary: City on the Tigris, approximately 35 km. north of Seleucia-Ctesiphon.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Bahdeidat
entry.summary: Bahdeidat is 12 km. northeast of Jbeil (Giblet or Byblos), 47 km. from Beirut, 550 m. above sea level.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Balad — ܒܠܕ
entry.summary: Balad, Assyrian Balaṭ, Syriac and Arabic Balad or Balaṭ, and modern Aski Mosul (Turkish for ‘Old Mosul’) are names referring to a town located some 40 km. northwest of Mosul, on the west bank of the Tigris.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Balikh — ܢܗܪ ܒܐܠܚ
entry.summary: A tributary of the Euphrates that enters it at al-Raqqa.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Bālulan
entry.summary: A city west of Urmia.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Barṭelle — ܒܪܛܠܗ
entry.summary: A small town located some 20 km. to the southeast of Mosul on the road that links this ciy with Arbela and on which Karamlish and Qaraqosh are also found.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Bashkale
entry.summary: A mountainous region southeast of Lake Van.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Bashosh
entry.summary: A village in northern Iraq.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Basila — ܒܐܣܝܠܐ
entry.summary: A village near Mardin.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Baṣra
entry.summary: A city in southern Iraq.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Baṭnan — ܒܛܢܢ
entry.summary: A town of Serugh.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Beirut
entry.summary: Beirut, Lebanon is mentioned in many Syr. Orth. texts in connection with the St. Jude monastery and church.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Bektaş — ܒܓܕܐܫܝܗ
entry.summary: A village southwest of Mardin, near Kfartuto.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Benshemesh — ܒܢܫܡܫ
entry.summary: A place east of the Khabur river in Jazira.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Berwari
entry.summary: A region in the Hakkari mountains.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Beth Aramaye
entry.summary: Ecclesiastical province of the Ch. of E., situated in Central Iraq.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Beth Debe — ܒܝܬ ܕܒ̈ܐ
entry.summary: A village in Ṭur ʿAbdin.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Beth Garmai — ܒܝܬ ܓܪ̈ܡܝ
entry.summary: An ecclesiastical province confined between the Lower Zab northward, the Tigris westward, the Diyālā river southward, and the mountains of Ḥimrīn eastward.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Beth Huzaye — ܟܘܙܣܬܐܢ
entry.summary: A diocese of the Church of the East, also known as Elam, centered around Beth Lapaṭ.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Beth Kiyūnā — ܒܝܬ ܟܢܘܢ̈ܐ
entry.summary: A village probably near Bārimmān.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Beth Lapaṭ
entry.summary: Chief city of Beth Huzaye/Khuzistan, whose metropolitan bishopric ranked second after that of Seleucia-Ctesiphon.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Beth Naʿar — ܒܝܬ ܢܥܪ
entry.summary: A village near Edessa.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Beth Nuhadra
entry.summary: An E.-Syr. bishopric seat the heartland of which was the region extending from the small Khabur river to the Tigris, including the area of modern Zakho and part of Dehok.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Beth Qaṭraye
entry.summary: The region known in Syriac as Beth Qaṭraye includes not only the peninsula of Qaṭar, but also its hinterland Yamāma, and the entire coast of northeast Arabia as far as the peninsula of Musandam, in present-day Oman, along with the islands.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Beth Qustan — ܒܝܬ ܩܣܝܢܐ
entry.summary: A village in Ṭur ʿAbdin.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Beth Sbirino — ܒܝܬ ܣܒܝܪܝܢܐ
entry.summary: A village in Ṭur ʿAbdin.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Beth Shahaq — ܒܝܬ ܫܗܐܩ
entry.summary: A village near Nineveh.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Beth ʿAbe
entry.summary: This famous monastery was founded in 595/6 by Yaʿqub, a monk of the 'Great Monastery' of Abraham of Kashkar (on the mountain of Izla), who originated from Lashom in Beth Garmai.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Beth ʿArbaye — ܒܐܥܪ̈ܒܐܝܐ
entry.summary: Ecclesiastical province extending from Beth Zabdai northward, Balad southward, and Nisibis westward, the latter being its capital city.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Beth ʿArīf — ܒܝܬ ܥܪܝܦ
entry.summary: A village near Jerusalem.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Bezona — ܕܝܪܐ ܒܝܙܘܢܐ
entry.summary: An unlocated monastery, perhaps near Maypherqaṭ.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Bīrqūm — ܒܝܪܩܘܡ
entry.summary: An unlocated monastery, perhaps near ʿĀnah.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Birtha — ܒܝܪܗܓܝܟ
entry.summary: A village on the Euphrates north of Mabbug and south of Samosata.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Bostra — ܒܘܨܪ
entry.summary: City in the Ḥawrān, present-day southern Syria, ca. 120 fan. south of Damascus.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Byblos
entry.summary: A port city between Beirut and Tripolis.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.summary: A port city in Palaestina north of Gaza.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.summary: A city in Cappadocia, modern Kayseri.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Cappadocia — ܩܦܐܕܘܩܝܐ

entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

David A. Michelson

entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Cilicia I

entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Cilicia II

entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

David A. Michelson

entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.summary: Located on the Tigris, south of modern Baghdad.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

David A. Michelson

David A. Michelson

entry.title: Dayr al-Ṣalīb — ܕܝܪܐ ܕܨܠܝܒܐ

David A. Michelson

entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson

entry.title: Dayr Mār Atūnūs — ܕܝܪܐ ܕܡܪܝ ܐܬܢܘܣ

entry.title: Dayr ʿAṭiya
entry.summary: A monastery between Nabk and Qara in Syria.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Defne — ܕܦܢܗ
entry.summary: A village near Ḥesno d-Kifo.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Diocaesarea

entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Doliche — ܕܠܘܟ

entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson

entry.title: School of Nisibis
entry.summary: The School of Nisibis was an E.-Syr. institution of learning founded in part by refugees from the School of Edessa after the latter was forcibly closed by the religious and political authorities in 489, because it had become an exegetical circle of dyophysite Christians whose Antiochene theology was no longer welcome in a Roman Empire split by Christological controversy.
entry.author: Thomas A. Carlson
David A. Michelson

entry.title: Urmia
entry.summary: Urmia (Urūmiyya, Rīzāya), a city in northwest Iran, west of Lake Urmia, is first mentioned in E.-Syr. sources in 1111, whereas the mentioning of bishops in Azerbaijan (Hoshaʿ of Ganzak in 486, Ḥenanishoʿ in 605), testify to earlier presence of the Ch. of E. in this region.
